name: Introduction to Anthropology
description: A basic overview of the field of anthropology, including its major sub-disciplines and primary topics of study.

name: History of Anthropological Thought
description: A survey of the major figures and theories in anthropology, starting with the 19th century and continuing through the present.

name: Introduction to Political Anthropology
description: An introduction to the major topics and theories of political anthropology, including political organization, power, and violence.

name: Research Methods in Political Anthropology
description: A comprehensive introduction to the methods used in the study of political anthropology, including participant observation, interviewing, archival research, and quantitative methods.

name: Advanced Topics in Political Anthropology
description: A course covering advanced topics in political anthropology, including topics such as identity, globalization, and state-society relations.
